name: df-ocv
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cocv, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpt(s1, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), crab(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wral(s3, cv(s1), wceq(co(cv(s2), cfv(cip, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), cfv(c0g, cfv(csca, cv(s0)))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ ocv =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà P((Base ` s0))‚Ü¶ { s2 ‚àà(Base ` s0)| ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà s1,(s2[(¬∑ ` s0)]s3)=(0 `(Scalar ` s0)))}))
comment: Define the orthocomplement function in a given set (which usually is a pre-Hilbert space): it associates with a subset its orthogonal subset (which in the case of a closed linear subspace is its orthocomplement). (Contributed by NM, 7-Oct-2011.)
